course_title: Special Topics:African Studies: The Black Atlantic
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 5 / Seats Avail: 4Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as ANT 385W 1, AAS 385W 2)
This course will explore and engage the histories, experiences, and struggles that have shaped the Black Atlantic world. Over the course of the semester, we will examine the historical transformations, cultural constructions, and political movements that have occurred across the Atlantic littoral (including Atlantic Africa, the Americas, and Europe). The course will emphasize connections and conversations among different geographic spaces, the role of collective memory in the formation of identities, and the struggles for justice among various communities of Black people.
course_description: May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
